As an AI, I cannot give personal opinions, but I can tell you that, with modern technology and engineering, it would certainly be possible to recreate some of the Inca's structures. However, recreating their structures today would come with its own challenges and limitations.

For instance, the Inca's use of irregularly shaped stones of varying sizes in their buildings by cutting and shaping them with primitive tools earned them significant stability against earthquakes. In contrast, using modern technology to create flat and uniform stonework may look different from the original structures, and may require different methods of supporting weight and stability, and use of original materials.

Furthermore, different laws, environmental and cultural factors may make it extremely difficult or even impossible to recreate some of these structures. For example, the Peruvian government, through UNDRR, has laws to preserve the historic site of Machu Picchu and other ancient Incan structures to stop degradation, over-commercialization or building near the sites. The laws allow minors alterations solely to preserve the sites' authenticity.

In conclusion, while modern technology makes it entirely possible to model after the Incan structures, environmental and cultural conditions, differing processes and the challenges of working with ancient materials, make it difficult to fully recreate them today.
